title: Newsletter 85:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A tragic fire occurred on Christmas Day 2020. A truck caught fire and was destroyed, as was part of the McGill Club. The damage to the McGIll Club was primarily due to the water used by the firemen to douse the blaze. More details to follow.
subject: Holidays;Tragedies;Firemen

title: Newsletter 86:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The truck fire cleanup continues. Contents of the truck included plastic bags for a chain restaurant.
subject: Tragedies

title: Newsletter 87:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith's talks about the history of the McGill Club (formerly the American Trading Co. circa 1906-1908.) Post-fire repair work begins on the McGill Club. Historic images of the 1911 brick-lined converter are included
subject: Converters;Businesses

title: Newsletter 88:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Several vintage images of the McGill Grade School (with students) are included. Present-day McGill experiences a quiet week.
subject: Schools;Sports;Football

title: Newsletter 89:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith explores images of early McGill Ranch. Present-day McGill experiences a mild winter so far.
subject: Smelters;Housing;Businesses

title: Newsletter 90:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Fun memories of McGill's Sheriff's Deputies during Keith's youth. Present-day McGill is quiet.
subject: People

title: Newsletter 91:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Vintage images of the McGill Club/Cypress Hall. The building started out as a single-story, with the Cypress Hall being added as the second story in 1920. Many parties were held at the building until fire codes became to stringent.
subject: Businesses

title: Newsletter 92:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls the tragic story of Sheriff Cliff Drietzler in the early 1940's. Cliff was murdered while on duty and a multi-state manhunt ensued. The suspect was captured and the trial began in McGill. Part II next week.
subject: People;Tragedies

title: Newsletter 93:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Murder suspect Kenneth Shepley went on trial for the murder of Deputy Cliff Drietzler. After a trial, Shepley was convicted of 2nd degree murder and 2 counts of grand larceny. He was sentenced to life in prison but was paroled in 1957. He then went to prison for the larceny charges.
subject: People;Tragedies

title: Newsletter 94:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Fishing was a fun and useful skill taught to McGill children. Keith remembers how he and other young McGill kids learned the basics of creek fishing in the 1930's - 1940's. Keith recalls some fun stories of fishing with friends from the past. Present-day McGill may get a new business!
subject: Businesses;Fishing

title: Newsletter 95:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The story of McGill resident Charles Overfelt and his experiences during WWII. Overfelt was tasked with guarding Japanese war criminal Hideki Tojo, who was eventually hanged for his part in planning the attack on Pearl Harbor. Present-day McGill remains quiet.
subject: WWII;People

title: Newsletter 96:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith includes many vintage photos of Main Street buildings and attempts to date them. A vintage image of tar paper shacks is included, circa 1905-1906.
subject: Main Street;Businesses;Housing

title: Newsletter 97:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Copper Club bar opened in 1908, replacing the tent structure that stood before the concrete building. The building is now the McGill Post Office. This newsletter contains much information about the history of this structure.
subject: Businesses;Main Street

title: Newsletter 98:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Memorial Day 1911 spurs memories of bands, patriotism, picnics and all-around fun! Modern-day McGill receives the good news that the gas station has been purchased by a new owner.
subject: Holidays

title: Newsletter 99:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith dates Main Street buildings and the gas station. Modern-day McGill gets an influx of tourists visiting the Drug Store.
subject: Main Street;Gas Stations

title: Newsletter 100:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: A McGill resident presents Keith with a town drawing from the early 1900s. The document confirms the presence of the London Pool Hall and the Greek Coffee House. Modern-day McGill is quiet as the new gas station acquires their food permit. Included is an image of the overflow ditch from the springs in the swimming pool/dairy area, circa 1908 or 1909.
subject: Main Street;Businesses

title: Newsletter 101:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls his first day of school from 1941. During this first year, the attack on Pearl Harbor took place and many McGill residents enlisted in the military to aid in the war effort. Japanese-American families were taken away and never seen again. Keith includes a photo of his adorable great-grandson!
subject: Schools;People

title: Newsletter 102:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith discusses the donation of the McGill Drug Store (by the Culbert family) to the White Pine County Museum Board. Visitors from all walks of life visit the drugstore. Modern-day McGill sees the opening of the new Pony Express gas station!
subject: Drug Stores;Gas Stations

title: Newsletter 103:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The Pony Express convenience store and gas station opens for business! The McGill town council is on hand to celebrate the opening. Work continues on the theater and the IOOF Hall. Vintage photos of the Stone Amusement Hall (which occupied the spot the current Pony Express is on) are included.
subject: Gas Stations;People

title: Newsletter 104:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill baseball field undergoes a revamp. A new field, playground and restrooms were added. The theater also undergoes a facelift as the brick is power-washed and shines like new!
subject: Sports;Baseball

title: Newsletter 105:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith shares the story the the 1919-1920 McGill Club fire that was (most likely) the result of a un-snuffed cigarette during the New Year's Eve party. Included is an image of the 1920 fire engine used to douse the blaze. While the all-volunteer firemen were unable to put out the fire, they did save the Post Office on the north side of the street. The McGill Club was rebuilt and still stands today.
subject: Tragedies;Main Street;Businesses

title: Newsletter 106:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith attempts to identify the location of the original (about 1910) McGill ballpark. Present-day McGill experiences a snowfall. The theater gets a power-wash.
subject: Sports;Baseball;Housing

title: Newsletter 107:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Fun times at the Schellbourne Bar and Cafe, just north of McGill, was owned by Lyman and Charlcia. The bar boasted a 'unique' customer who never left his preferred seat. A present-day image of the theater is included. Looking good!
subject: Businesses

title: Newsletter 108:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The ballpark mystery deepens - possibly a third park? Present-day McGill is inundated by some speeding cars.
subject: Sports;Baseball

title: Newsletter 109:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Coming Soon!

title: Newsletter 110:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls a tragic plane crash that killed two brothers. Present-day McGill has another quiet week. A vintage image of the McGill concentrator baseball team is included.
subject: Tragedies;People;Sports;Baseball

title: Newsletter 135:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Keith recalls another post Pearl Harbor Christmas, which was celebrated with mixed blessings due to the ongoing war. Toys for the children were scarce, but families celebrated the holiday with more meaning as they realized the sacrifice the service men and women were making for their country.
subject: WWII;Holidays

title: Newsletter 136:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Christmas Memories - Part II.
subject: WWII;Holidays

title: Newsletter 137:Keith's Corner-McGill News
creator: Keith Gibson

title: The McGill band performs.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The McGill band performs at a possible Memorial Day picnic.
subject: Bands;Holidays

title: Foundry workers pouring molten metal.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Foundry workers pouring molten metal into molds at Kennecott from about 1950.
subject: Kennecott;Smelters

title: Lage's (Stage Stop) in the late 1940's or early 1950's.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Great image of a family fishing event. L-R: Dick McGuire, Bonnie Bowen, Grandma, Grandpa, Same Lage, Joe Bowen, Elmer Bowen.
subject: Fishing;People

title: Beautiful fall colors in McGill
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Fall comes to McGill in October of 2021.
subject: Seasons

title: Trestle construction, circa 1908.
creator: Keith Gibson
description: The huge beam in the bottom left will be part of the trestle being built in the background.
subject: Kennecott

title: McGill Card Club - 1940's
creator: Keith Gibson
description: Happy times at the McGill Card Club.
subject: People
